selection_reasoning: Selected the top three performers which represent the best grid-based, global optimization, and boundary-filling strategies. Included a coordinate descent approach for algorithmic diversity.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score (2.6261), very close to the benchmark. Uses multi-grid initialization and shaking, proving that starting configuration diversity is key.
Second highest score (2.6260). Uses Basin-Hopping global optimization. This approach is excellent for fine-tuning and escaping local optima.
Strong performance (2.6182) using a refined boundary-filling strategy. It provides a different geometric arrangement than the grid-based 1_1.
Good score (2.6093) using a coordinate descent approach. This iterative refinement method is a distinct optimization flavor that could be hybridized.
